episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including swimming elephants in the Andaman Islands, a French parliamentary maneuver involving MPs hiding behind curtains, a Chinese theme park ride simulating cremation, and Peter O'Toole's unusual method of smuggling earrings.

facts.fact: Logs used to be carried around the Andaman Islands by swimming elephants.
There is a French parliamentary manoeuvre which involves MPs hiding behind a curtain and then bursting out to vote at the last minute.
One of the biggest theme parks in China has a ride that puts visitors in a coffin, rolls them into a chamber, and then simulates their cremation.
The actor, Peter O'Toole, once smuggled a pair of earrings out of Greece by hiding them in his foreskin.
